text: Umberto "Bert" Rossi (1 November 1922 â€“ 2 July 2017) was an English gangster and former associate of the Kray twins. He was known as the "General of Clerkenwell". He stood trial for murder in 1975 but was acquitted. He was a journalist linked him to 11 murders, a figure which he did not dispute. He was born in Clerkenwell, London, England. Rossi died on 2 July 2017 in London at age of 94. ==Further reading== *Morton, James. (2017) Bert Rossi: Britain's oldest London gangland boss. National Crime Syndicate Publishing. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1922 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Criminals from London
title: Bert Rossi
